summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing the provision of counseling sessions for victims/clients of Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence centers on clarifying whether the FBI has agreed to pay for more than the pre-approved 12 sessions per client and expresses concern about potential additional requests.

persons.name: Young, N.
persons.context: FBI agent in New York copied on an email discussing counseling services for Epstein victims.

events.title: Inquiry about counseling sessions for Epstein victims
events.description: An FBI agent receives a text message from their daughter inquiring about whether the FBI has agreed to pay for more than 12 pre-approved counseling sessions for Epstein victims/clients.

events.title: Clarification on counseling session funding
events.description: FBI personnel correspond to clarify that the FBI did not agree to pay for more than 12 pre-approved counseling sessions per client for Epstein victims, and express concern about potential requests for additional clients.

keyFacts: The FBI was involved in arranging and funding counseling services for victims/clients of Jeffrey Epstein.
The standard arrangement appears to have been 12 pre-approved counseling sessions paid for by the FBI per client.
There was internal concern among FBI personnel about potential requests for additional counseling sessions or for additional clients beyond the agreed-upon terms.
The communication indicates an ongoing process of victim support within the Epstein investigation as of late 2020.
